title: Professional Vocabulary·Text Transformation and Translingual Learning Design Course for Net Generation Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (reading, writing, speaking, listening), professional fieldwork experience, understanding of basic grammar, and experience using digital collaboration tools
context.additional_context: Conducted in a blended learning environment combining smartphone-based collaboration tools (e.g., Google Docs, Padlet) with offline activities. Focuses on strengthening learners' professional expression skills and enhancing multilayered text interpretation abilities. Particularly emphasizes grammar application and vocabulary expansion strategies in digital environments.

learning_goals: Through project-based tasks, learners improve practical language skills—including specialized vocabulary use and complex text analysis—by ≥30%.
In digital collaboration projects, learners apply self-directed problem-solving strategies ≥2 times and optimize advanced grammatical structures and context-specific expressions.
Through reflective journaling, learners systematically analyze their language learning processes and develop plans to improve critical reading and academic writing skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
